channel.title: Vista Question
channel.description: When I try to make a web page my desktop background, it tells me can't because it's not the right file type. Is there a way to bypass this?

item.title: Vista Question
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

[quote=“nator123123, post:10, topic:95394”]Wait. Is Alienware a theme?
ex. WinXP Form: Desktop>Properties>Themes>(NAME OF THEME)
or
Desktop>Properties>Appearance>Windows and buttons:>(NAME OF THEME)
I thought it was an operating system.
How long does it take to download it?

EDIT: It says AlienGUIse is only for XP, and I’m not switching back to that cuz I’ll have questioning to do.
There a way to have Vista Compatibility, or make Windows XP a dual-boot?[/quote]
Err…?

Topic will be changed soon I bet.

Read full topic

item.title: Vista Question
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:13, topic:95394”][quote author=deoxys505 link=topic=137870.msg1338387#msg1338387 date=1179558866]

[quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=137870.msg1338366#msg1338366 date=1179558577]

wow they did…then I’m not getting vista, cause if I can’t put my background that I like then it sucks!..
[/quote]thats funny. Why did microsoft put active desktop on it in the first place? If someone wants/needs to go to that page, IMO i think they should open up their browser instead of being lazy…

Actually, having a webpage as a background can be a hell of a good thing, you can use offline hacks to have a small navigation bar to change background, functions to get info from other pages, such as stuff from mopar, a small java applet to display much more things than windows can, omfg why didn’t I think of this before!
[me=The Un-Named]goes to sexi his desktop up.[/me]
[/quote]post a pic when done sexi’ing up your 'top.

It will probably be a while.[/quote]lol, i can wait.

Read full topic

item.title: Vista Question
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

Wait. Is Alienware a theme?
ex. WinXP Form: Desktop>Properties>Themes>(NAME OF THEME)
or
Desktop>Properties>Appearance>Windows and buttons:>(NAME OF THEME)
I thought it was an operating system.
How long does it take to download it?

EDIT: It says AlienGUIse is only for XP, and I’m not switching back to that cuz I’ll have questioning to do.
There a way to have Vista Compatibility, or make Windows XP a dual-boot?

item.title: Vista Question
item.dc:creator: @kilermage3 kilermage3
item.description:
@kilermage3 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:7, topic:95394”][quote author=kilermage3 link=topic=137870.msg1335123#msg1335123 date=1179504712]

vista is gay shit, Get alienware. Goto alienware.com then go to desktop skinz and download the GUIse and then youll get a alien head icon on your desktop and select a theme.

Ya I had that but it screwes up with your pc’s themes. So when you take them out it will still be there.
[/quote]

You dont uninstall it when you have the theme dumbass, you apply windows xp back and then uninstall. And its just a skin, wont rune anything. Vista is a whole theme.[/quote]

Um, I know that it was a skin so I applied xp back and then it was still there. So I uninstall and woo it gone.

Read full topic

vista is gay shit, Get alienware. Goto alienware.com then go to desktop skinz and download the GUIse and then youll get a alien head icon on your desktop and select a theme.
[/quote]

Ya I had that but it screwes up with your pc’s themes. So when you take them out it will still be there.[/quote]

You dont uninstall it when you have the theme dumbass, you apply windows xp back and then uninstall. And its just a skin, wont rune anything. Vista is a whole theme.
